By and , it suffices to prove the first claim. In [D1970, II, (6.9)] or [AH1955], one can find a proof of the fact that \beta is a quasi-isomorphism, and thus a filtered quasi-isomorphism. The question is local on X. We can thus suppose that X is an open polycylinder D^m, with D = \{z\in \mathbb {C} \mid |z|<1\} and also that Y=\bigcup _{k=1}^\ell Y_k with Y_k=\operatorname {pr}_k^{-1}(0).
